DROP TABLE IF EXISTS migration_doc_folders_and_files;
CREATE TABLE migration_doc_folders_and_files as
(
    select uuid() newItemId, t.* from
        (select id
        , SUBSTRING_INDEX(name, '/', -1) name
        , parent_Id
        , case when fileSortType = 30 then 'file' else case when fileSortType = 20 then 'document' else case when fileSortType = 10 then 'folder' else '??' end end end itemType
    from t_file_base
    where forEvent = 0) t
);

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS migration_doc_folders;
CREATE TABLE migration_doc_folders as
(
    with RECURSIVE r_folders
    as 
    (
        select
        id
        , newItemId
        , parent_id
        , name
        , 0 as depth
        from migration_doc_folders_and_files
        where parent_id is null
        and itemType = 'folder'
        union all
        select faf.id
        , faf.newItemId
        , faf.parent_id
        , faf.name
        , depth + 1 as depth
        from migration_doc_folders_and_files faf
        join r_folders f on faf.parent_id = f.id
        where faf.itemType = 'folder'
    )

    select f.*, faf.newItemId newParentItemId,
    ROW_NUMBER() over (order by depth) row_num
    from r_folders f
    left join migration_doc_folders_and_files faf on f.parent_id = faf.id
);

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS migration_doc_files;
CREATE TABLE migration_doc_files as
(
    select faf1.*
     , faf2.newItemId newParentItemId
     , ROW_NUMBER() over (order by id) row_num
     from migration_doc_folders_and_files faf1
     join migration_doc_folders_and_files faf2 on faf1.parent_id = faf2.id
     where faf1.itemType = 'file'
);
select count(*) foldersCount from migration_doc_folders;

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS migration_doc_images_with_folders;
CREATE TABLE migration_doc_images_with_folders as
(

with
rootImageFolderId as
(
    select id from t_image_folder where parent_Id is null limit 1
),

image_folders AS
(
    select distinct id
    , uuid() newItemId
    , parent_id
    , SUBSTRING_INDEX(name, '/', -1) name
    , 'imageFolder' itemType
    from t_image_folder
),

images AS
(
select
 rpxi.id
 , uuid() newItemId 
 , IFNULL(rpxi.folder_id, rif.id) parent_Id
 , SUBSTRING_INDEX(fileName, '/', -1) name
 , 'image' itemType
 from t_rpx_image rpxi
 join rootImageFolderId rif on 1 = 1
 left join image_folders ifs on IFNULL(rpxi.folder_id, rif.id) = ifs.id
 )

select *
 from images
union 
select *
 from image_folders
);

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS migration_doc_image_folders;
CREATE TABLE migration_doc_image_folders as
(
    with RECURSIVE r_folders
    as 
    (
        select
        id
        , newItemId
        , parent_id
        , name
        , 0 as depth
        from migration_doc_images_with_folders
        where parent_id is null
        and itemType = 'imageFolder'
        union all
        select iwf.id
        , iwf.newItemId
        , iwf.parent_id
        , iwf.name
        , depth + 1 as depth
        from migration_doc_images_with_folders iwf
        join r_folders f on iwf.parent_id = f.id
        where iwf.itemType = 'imageFolder'
    )

    select f.*, iwf.newItemId newParentItemId,
    ROW_NUMBER() over (order by depth) row_num
    from r_folders f
    left join migration_doc_images_with_folders iwf on f.parent_id = iwf.id
);

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS migration_doc_images;
CREATE TABLE migration_doc_images as
(
    select iwf1.*, iwf2.newItemId newParentItemId
    from migration_doc_images_with_folders iwf1
    join migration_doc_images_with_folders iwf2 on iwf1.parent_id = iwf2.id
    where iwf1.itemType = 'image'
);


select count(*) imagesCount from migration_doc_images;
